html: What the #HMRC testimony at @CommonsTreasury shows is very important. There will not be a hard border in Ireland under any circumstances. It follows from this the backstop is a political choice rather than a customs necessity.
text: What the #HMRC testimony at @CommonsTreasury shows is very important.  There will not be a hard border in Ireland under any circumstances.  It follows from this the backstop is a political choice rather than a customs necessity.

html: Quizzed HMRC leadership today @CommonsTreasury. They were clear: - no need for any infrastructure whatever at Irish border in any scenario - no instructions to introduce it - any new arrangements can be ready in 24 months from point of clarity So why do we need the #backstop?
text:
Quizzed HMRC leadership today @CommonsTreasury. They were clear:
- no need for any infrastructure whatever at Irish border in any scenario
- no instructions to introduce it
- any new arrangements can be ready in 24 months from point of clarity
So why do we need the #backstop?

What I found interesting was a term that Dominic Raab used when explaining why he quit.

He used the word BLACKMAIL in relation to the way the EU are negotiating.

I think as Andrew Neil pointed out last night when one party bullies another in a negotiation it NEVER ends well.

html: 1/3 On the Norwegian Frigate Helge colliding with a tanker. This we know: 1. Seven people are hurt – hopefully not seriously 2.The Captain deliberately drove onto the rocks to save the ship. Right up there with the hardest and bravest of decisions.pic.twitter.com/ANlDyFFrDt
text:
1/3
On the Norwegian Frigate Helge colliding with a tanker. This we know:
1. Seven people are hurt – hopefully not seriously
2.The Captain deliberately drove onto the rocks to save the ship. Right up there with the hardest and bravest of decisions.pic.twitter.com/ANlDyFFrDt

html: Budget défense 2019 adopté à l’Assemblée nationale : 35,9 milliards d’euros, +1,7 milliard par rapport à 2018 moyens pour le Plan Famille multipliés par 2,5 19,5 milliards pour nos équipements Ce budget, c’est l’acte I de la LPM : le renouveau de nos Armées commence.
text:
Budget défense 2019 adopté à l’Assemblée nationale :
 35,9 milliards d’euros, +1,7 milliard par rapport à 2018
 moyens pour le Plan Famille multipliés par 2,5
 19,5 milliards pour nos équipements

Ce budget, c’est l’acte I de la LPM : le renouveau de nos Armées commence.

html: Some loud, persuasive, and misguided UK voices have been telling the EU that if they dig their heels in the UK would buckle and not leave. I fear the EU believed them and have negotiated based on that fallacy. Those voices have acted against both the UK’s and EU’s best interests
text:
Some loud, persuasive, and misguided UK voices have been telling the EU that if they dig their heels in the UK would buckle and not leave.

I fear the EU believed them and have negotiated based on that fallacy. Those voices have acted against both the UK’s and EU’s best interests

html: Dear BBC 6 o’clock news. It isn’t 40 countries with EU trade deals, it’s 40 deals with 70 countries. And it’s not 12% of UK trade dependent on them. It’s 12% of UK trade with the countries, much of which won’t depend on the deals. @BBCNews

html: There's a good case for keeping chunks of the single market (eg rules on competition, non-discrimination, standards). But remaining in the customs union while leaving the EU would be the worst imaginable outcome. There's joyful disbelief in Brussels that we're comptemplating it.

html: Only 2 days to go until the biggest ever #IllegalWildlifeTrade Conference in London. Over 80 countries are coming together to #EndWildlifeCrime by: tackling corruption and illicit financial flows closing down markets building coalitions https://www.gov.uk/government/topical-events/london-conference-on-the-illegal-wildlife-trade-2018 …pic.twitter.com/aRKqdBd0BR
text:
Only 2 days to go until the biggest ever #IllegalWildlifeTrade Conference in London.

Over 80 countries are coming together to #EndWildlifeCrime by:

tackling corruption and illicit financial flows

html: If I could reverse time, Remain would win, but it lost; Canada++ would be our negotiating model, but there’s the Chequers mess instead. The choice now is between Chequers more diluted by negotiation and the WTO default position. Only the latter is consistent with the Referendum.
text: If I could reverse time, Remain would win, but it lost; Canada++ would be our negotiating model, but there’s the Chequers mess instead. The choice now is between Chequers more diluted by negotiation and the WTO default position. Only the latter is consistent with the Referendum.

html: Willie Walsh, head IAG - which owns British Airways & Aer Lingus - says we should be 'sanguine' about Brexit. 'Brexit is inevitable. There are some issues that will need to deal with but it's not rocket science'. He's clear that planes will keep flying over Ireland
text:
Willie Walsh, head IAG - which owns British Airways & Aer Lingus - says we should be 'sanguine' about Brexit. 

'Brexit is inevitable. There are some issues that will need to deal with but it's not rocket science'. 

He's clear that planes will keep flying over Ireland

html: What's this tosh about giant lorry parks after 'no-deal' Brexit? The WTO Trade Facilitation Agreement (ratified by 136, including EU, states in 2017) mandates seamless, hi-tech practices at the border. The World Bank reported in 2016 that 98% of border traffic went unchecked.
text: What's this tosh about giant lorry parks after 'no-deal' Brexit? The WTO Trade Facilitation Agreement (ratified by 136, including EU, states in 2017) mandates seamless, hi-tech practices at the border. The World Bank reported in 2016 that 98% of border traffic went unchecked.

Last week @BestForBritain blasted Vote Leave for an incorrect spending return, saying: "it is time for them to admit the campaign was dodgy. They need to apologise." 

Today Best for Britain have been fined by the Electoral Commission for an incorrect spending return in 2017.

html: Brilliant news that the Parental Bereavement Leave Bill has now passed both the House of Commons and the House of Lords which means when we return from recess it will become and Act of Parliament. Thank you to @kevinhollinrake and @LordJimKnight for taking it through Parliament.

text:
EXCLUSIVE: Pay rise for @RoyalNavy, @BritishArmy, @RoyalAirForce today. Set to be a 2% rise, topped up by 0.9% “bonus” back dated to April. Not the permanent 3% boost that had been expected but 1st rise above 1% in 5 years. Will be welcomed

html: A brighter future for the British fishing industry As we leave the EU, the UK will be an independent coastal state, taking back control of our waters & natural resources, as well as the flexibility to negotiate with other countries and ensure stocks are fished sustainably.pic.twitter.com/l2Jlm6UOnw
text:
A brighter future for the British fishing industry 

As we leave the EU, the UK will be an independent coastal state, taking back control of our waters & natural resources, as well as the flexibility to negotiate with other countries and ensure stocks are fished sustainably.pic.twitter.com/l2Jlm6UOnw

text:
#NHS70
This time last year I was in the back of an Ambulance 
Mountain Rescue and a team of Doctors had Revived me and Stabilised my condition. The ambulance stoped in a lay-by and the crew worked hard to keep me alive.
I owe my life to the NHS
